# R

Below is a selected list of R packages I have developed. All packages can be installed from [my R-universe public repository](https://vgherard.r-universe.dev/).

### **[`{r2r}`](https://vgherard.github.io/r2r/)**
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/r2r)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=r2r)

*R-Object to R-Object Hash Maps.*
Implementation of hash tables (hash sets and hash maps) in R, featuring arbitrary R objects as keys, arbitrary hash and key-comparison functions, and customizable behaviour upon queries of missing keys. 



### **[`{kgrams}`](https://vgherard.github.io/kgrams/)**
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/kgrams)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=kgrams)

*Classical k-gram Language Models.* 
Tools for training and evaluating k-gram language models in R, supporting several probability smoothing techniques, perplexity computations, random text generation and more.

### **[`{sbo}`](https://vgherard.github.io/sbo/)**
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/sbo)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=sbo)

*Text Prediction via Stupid Back-Off N-Gram Models.*
Utilities for training and evaluating text predictors based on Stupid Back-Off N-gram models [(Brants et al., 2007)](<https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/D07-1090/>).

### **[`{scribblr}`]()**
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/scribblr)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=scribblr)

*A Minimalist Notepad Inside RStudio.*
A minimalist RStudio Addin for taking project-related notes without distractions.

### **[`{fcci}`](https://vgherard.github.io/fcci/)** 
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/fcci)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=fcci)

*Feldman-Cousins Confidence Intervals.*
Provides support for building Feldman-Cousins confidence intervals [(G. J. Feldman and R. D. Cousins, 1998)](<doi:10.1103/PhysRevD.57.3873>).

### **[`{gsample}`](https://github.com/vgherard/gsample/)**
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/gsample)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=gsample)

*Efficient Weighted Sampling Without Replacement.* Sample without replacement using the [Gumbel-Max trick](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1903.06059.pdf).
